summary: Project involves a product catalog application where customers should be able to view shared catalogs/product links without logging in. There is an ongoing issue with login prompts appearing for customers and an 'Add Product' button being visible that should be hidden from customer-facing views.
architectural_notes: Customer-facing catalog/product views should be publicly accessible without authentication
UI controls like 'Add Product' should only be visible to authenticated admin/seller users, not customers
known_issues: Shared catalog/product links still prompt customers to login instead of loading publicly
'Add Product' button is visible in customer-facing catalog view â€” should be hidden

existing_features.title: Public catalog and product detail pages must be fully accessible without authentication. Customers visiting shared catalog or product links must NOT be redirected to a login page or prompted to log in. Anonymous (unauthenticated) access to these pages must be allowed by default.
The 'Add Product' button must not be visible on the public/customer-facing catalog page. It should only be visible to authenticated weaver owners managing their own catalog.

new_feature_requests.summary: Allow public/unauthenticated access to shared catalog and product links (no login prompt for customers)
Hide 'Add Product' button from customer-facing catalog views

projectName: Remove login prompt and hide Add Product button from customer-facing catalog views
